title: Gargoyle Stoneplate Problem

embed.description: Post with 1 views. which description should be correct?

body: So the patch notes and the in-game description are not the same. Which one is supposed to be the correct description?

replies.body: I grabbed a few more pairs of eyes to make sure I was reading those descriptions correctly. The wording they use IS different, but all of the stats are exactly the same. The only real different between those descriptions is that the in-game one lists the 90 sec Cooldown.

Except 40% of current health and 40% of Max health are different, if you get 40% of current health when you activate it and not 40% of Max health. Those could be drastically different. If I have 2000 current health and 4000 max health and I get 40% of max, that will be 1600. In the same scenario if I only get 40% of current I only get 800. It is at the least unclear in game and should be clarified, but it doesn't seem as if it gives maximum health gain in game.

Ahhhhhh I see that now! So the more in-depth description is the correct one, you get 40% of your MAXIMUM Health. The in-game tooltip doesn't say maximum or current, so they aren't really conflicting, but I definitely see where that could be confusing. 

I'm going to reach out to who I can to try and get that updated for you, but in the future this might be better posted in Gameplay or Report a Bug ^_^!

Well your maximum increases by 40% or 100% but your current hp% also stays the same. So a person with 2000 max health at current health of 1000 would get maximum health of 4000 but curernt health of 2000.
